meanings.definition: To subject (organic matter) to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen, resulting in the decomposition of the material into volatile products.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was pyrolysing the wood to study its components.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician is pyrolysing the samples for analysis.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally started pyrolysing the vegetables while trying a new cooking technique.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat was pyrolysing the plastic, releasing toxic fumes.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was pyrolysing everything in its path, leaving only ashes behind.

meanings.definition: The process of breaking down organic matter through high temperature in the absence of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: Pyrolysing is commonly used in waste management to reduce organic waste.
meanings.sent2: The factory has a specialized machine for pyrolysing organic materials.
meanings.sent3: The students conducted an experiment on pyrolysing different types of leaves.
meanings.sent4: The art installation symbolized the cycle of life through pyrolysing organic matter.
meanings.sent5: The farmer learned about pyrolysing as a sustainable way to manage agricultural waste.
